intro: Hieracium skutudalicum, commonly known as the Skutudal hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can be found in meadows and grasslands. It has basal leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium skutudalicum is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habit.
